prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
Firefighters and police were seen outside the office of Mike Freer MP

Police are investigating a suspected arson attack at the office of North London Conservative MP Mike Freer.

A fire broke out at the rear of the North Finchley and Golders Green MP's constituency office at around 19:00 on Christmas Eve.

The Met Police confirmed it is investigating the fire.

Mr Freer told the BBC the fire happened at the rear of the premises and no one was in the building at the time of the incident.

He continued: "The police and fire brigade were on the scene in minutes and have been incredible in their response."

London Fire Brigade (LFB) confirmed the fire started in a shed outside the office before spreading to the rest of the building.

An LFB spokesperson said: "An external shed was destroyed by fire. Part of the first, second and third floors of the property were also damaged by the blaze."

In a statement, a Metropolitan Police spokesperson said: "The cause of the fire is under investigation as it is believed it may have been started deliberately. There have been no arrests."

Pictures posted on social media showed Metropolitan Police and LFB vehicles at the premises on Sunday evening.

Mr Freer has represented the North London constituency since 2010.

He is parliamentary under-secretary of state for courts and legal services, a junior role in the Ministry of Justice.

Pictures show the fire spread to an office inside the building

Firefighters and police were seen outside the office of Mike Freer MP

Police are investigating a suspected arson attack at the office of North London Conservative MP Mike Freer.

A fire broke out at the rear of the North Finchley and Golders Green MP's constituency office at around 19:00 on Christmas Eve.

The Met Police confirmed it is investigating the fire.

Mike Freer told the BBC the fire happened at the rear of the premises and no one was in the building at the time of the incident.

He continued: "The police and fire brigade were on the scene in minutes and have been incredible in their response."

London Fire Brigade (LFB) confirmed the fire started in a shed outside the office before spreading to the rest of the building.

An LFB spokesperson said: "An external shed was destroyed by fire. Part of the first, second and third floors of the property were also damaged by the blaze."

In a statement, a Metropolitan Police spokesperson said: "The cause of the fire is under investigation as it is believed it may have been started deliberately. There have been no arrests."

Pictures posted on social media showed Metropolitan Police and LFB vehicles at the premises on Sunday evening.

Mike Freer has represented the North London constituency since 2010.

He is parliamentary under-secretary of state for courts and legal services, a junior role in the Ministry of Justice.

The blaze was "under control" by 19:45, according to the LFB.

The MP told the BBC he was "extremely concerned" about the incident, and "very angry" it had happened at all.

"I've lived in North Finchley all my life and never seen anything like this," he added.

It was not the first time a building linked to Mr Freer has been damaged by fire.

In 2017, a blaze broke out in the basement of his constituency office, destroying the ground floor and part of the first.

Four people were taken to hospital following the incident, but no one was seriously hurt.

Mike Freer has represented the North London constituency since 2010.

He is parliamentary under-secretary of state for courts and legal services, a junior role in the Ministry of Justice.

He has previously served as minister for equalities, and as the chairman of the All-Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) for the Policing and Crime Bill.

Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there lived a brave knight named Sir Lancelot. He was a fearless warrior, always ready to defend the kingdom from any danger that may arise.

One day, while out on a quest, Sir Lancelot stumbled upon a young maiden in distress. Her name was Princess Isabella, and she had been kidnapped by an evil dragon. Sir Lancelot knew that he had to save her, and so he set off on a daring rescue mission.

The journey to the dragon's lair was long and treacherous, filled with perilous obstacles and fierce creatures. But Sir Lancelot was determined to rescue the princess, and so he pressed on, using all of his strength and skill to overcome each challenge.

Finally, after many days of travel, Sir Lancelot arrived at the dragon's lair. He knew that this would be his toughest battle yet, but he was ready for it. With a mighty sword in hand, he charged into the dragon's den, ready to do battle with the fearsome beast.

The battle was fierce and intense, with Sir Lancelot and the dragon exchanging blow after blow. But in the end, Sir Lancelot's bravery and skill won out, and he was able to defeat the dragon and rescue Princess Isabella.

As he led the princess back to the kingdom, Sir Lancelot knew that he had done a great deed. He had not only saved the princess, but he had also proven himself to be a true hero. And so, he returned to the castle, welcomed by the cheers and admiration of all who knew him.

From that day on, Sir Lancelot was known throughout the land as a hero, a knight who would always be there to protect the kingdom and its people. And so, he continued to live a life of adventure and heroism, always ready to defend the weak and fight for justice.

Once upon a time, in a faraway kingdom, lived a knight named Sir Lancelot. He was brave, honorable, and skilled in combat, and was loved by all in his kingdom. One day, he received a message from the King that his daughter, Princess Isabella, had been captured by a fearsome dragon.

Without hesitation, Sir Lancelot set out on a quest to save the princess. Along the way, he faced many challenges and fought fierce battles against creatures that tried to stop him. But with his trusty sword and shield, he managed to overcome every obstacle in his path.

After many days of travel, he finally arrived at the dragon's lair. The dragon was enormous and breathed fire, but Sir Lancelot was undaunted. He charged at the dragon with his sword, and after a fierce battle, he emerged victorious.

With the dragon defeated, Sir Lancelot rescued Princess Isabella and brought her back to her father. The King was overjoyed and rewarded Sir Lancelot with gold and riches. But Sir Lancelot was not content with riches alone. He wanted to continue his quest and help those in need.

So, he set out on a journey to find those in need of his help. Along the way, he faced many more challenges and fought more battles, but he never lost his courage or his resolve. And with each victory, he grew stronger and more respected.

Finally, he arrived at a remote village that was being terrorized by a group of bandits. Sir Lancelot fought them bravely and defeated them, saving the villagers from their cruelty. The villagers were overjoyed and celebrated his victory with a great feast.

As the years passed, Sir Lancelot continued his quest to help those in need, and he became known throughout the land as a hero and a symbol of hope. He lived a long and fulfilling life, knowing that he had made a difference in the world and that his legacy would live on forever.

After many days of travel, he finally arrived at the dragon's lair. The dragon was enormous and breathed fire, but Sir Lancelot was undaunted. He charged at the dragon with his sword, and after a fierce battle, he emerged victorious.

With the dragon defeated, Sir Lancelot rescued Princess Isabella and brought her back to her father. The King was overjoyed and rewarded Sir Lancelot with gold and riches. But Sir Lancelot was not content with riches alone. He wanted to continue his quest and help those in need.

So, he set out on a journey to find those in need of his help. Along the way, he faced many more challenges and fought more battles, but he never lost his courage or his resolve. And with each victory, he grew stronger and more respected.

Finally, he arrived at a remote village that was being terrorized by a group of bandits. Sir Lancelot fought them bravely and defeated them, saving the villagers from their cruelty. The villagers were overjoyed and celebrated his victory with a great feast.

As the years passed, Sir Lancelot continued his quest to help those in need, and he became known throughout the land as a hero and a symbol of hope. He lived a long and fulfilling life, knowing that he had made a difference in the world and that his legacy would live on forever.
